newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary Postabank president reassures customers.
newsitem.headline: Hungary Postabank president reassures customers.

text.p: Hungary's Postabank head Gabor Princz denied on Friday that his bank was in financial trouble despite rumours which have sent thousands of customers to branches to withdraw their cash.
"It is not true news that Postabank has financial problems but true that there are rumours spreading in Budapest," Princz told Hungarian radio. "This has a damaging effect on the bank."
Robert Muranyi, Postabank's deputy general director said there was nothing behind the rumours.
"The bank is liquid," he told Reuters. "It increased its assets by more than 40 percent last year and is working with profit."

"We are able to satisfy all cash claims," he said, adding that even if people continued to take money out, the bank would be able to pay as it has "tens of billions" of forints which can be used for payouts.
